title: Footage emerges of Club Brugge star Dennis promising to get inked if he netted against Real Madrid
text:
Club Brugge striker Emmanuel Dennis may have booked himself an appointment at the tattoo parlour following his brace against Real Madrid.

The Nigerian scored two goals at the Bernabeu as Brugge earned a creditable 2-2 draw in the Champions League group stage match.

The 21-year-old produced a bizarre scuff and a stylish chip to propel his side into a 2-0 half-time lead, and footage has emerged of his pre-match premonition.

Club Brugge striker Emmanuel Dennis (left) celebrates his first goal against Real Madrid

Dennis looks around the Bernabeu on the eve of Real Madrid's UCL clash with Club Brugge

Club Brugge posted a video on Youtube of their players taking a tour of the Bernabeu on the eve of the game, and Dennis was in awe of the iconic ground.

He said: 'How many thousand capacity? 81,000 bro, this is Real Madrid.'

'Santiago Bernabeu, this is a dream. A lot of people didn't even think they would come here to play.'

The Nigerian uses his phone to check the capacity of the famous old ground

Dennis: 'This is a dream. A lot of people didn't even think they would come here to play'

If I score then I will get a tattoo on my skin, bro.'

Sergio Ramos hauled the hosts back into the game after nodding home a teasing cross from Karim Benzema at the start of the second half.

Casemiro then scored a late header from Toni Kroos' delivery to earn the hosts a share of the spoils.

Brugge moved into second in Group A with two draws from their opening two matches after Paris Saint-Germain earned a 1-0 away victory over Galatasaray.
description: Club Brugge striker Emmanuel Dennis may have booked himself an appointment at the tattoo parlour following his brace against Real Madrid. The Nigerian scored two goals at the Bernabeu.
